body_html:
Ok... I figured out the cause for ImportError: DLL load failed and also figured out the way to debug this systematically. I have seen this error occuring because either cuDNN or CUDA toolkit DLLs being of wrong version or found in Anaconda folder instead of NVidia's folder. I've written a blog post on how to debug this error:

http://shitalshah.com/p/debugging-tensorflow-dll-importerror/

Hope this helps.
body_text:
Ok... I figured out the cause for ImportError: DLL load failed and also figured out the way to debug this systematically. I have seen this error occuring because either cuDNN or CUDA toolkit DLLs being of wrong version or found in Anaconda folder instead of NVidia's folder. I've written a blog post on how to debug this error:
http://shitalshah.com/p/debugging-tensorflow-dll-importerror/
Hope this helps.
body:
Ok... I figured out the cause for `ImportError: DLL load failed` and also figured out the way to debug this systematically. I have seen this error occuring because either cuDNN or CUDA toolkit DLLs being of wrong version or found in Anaconda folder instead of NVidia's folder. I've written a blog post on how to debug this error:

http://shitalshah.com/p/debugging-tensorflow-dll-importerror/

Hope this helps.
